title: Gizachew Tessema
text:
About - A/Prof Gizachew Tessema
Welcome to my personal website. I am a perinatal and reproductive epidemiologist, global health and health services researcher, and a teaching and research academic. I am also the co-head of the Epidemiology Research Lab at Curtin University, Perth, Australia
My research is well-recognized in perinatal and reproductive epidemiology, health services research, and global health. After receiving my PhD in 2018 with the Dean’s Commendation for doctoral thesis excellence from the University of Adelaide, I was awarded an NHMRC Emerging Leadership (EL1) grant to develop a risk prediction model aimed at preventing avoidable adverse perinatal outcomes in Australia. I have published over 100 journal articles in high-impact, peer-reviewed journals.
I have received numerous honors and awards for excellence in research, science communication, research supervision, and the quality, impact, and significance of my work. Notable awards include the WA Young Tall Poppy Award (2022), Raine Research Prize (2022), Global Health Research Award (2022) from IPUMS DHS & PMA, STEM Early Career Researcher of the Year at Curtin (2022), Early- and Mid-Career Researcher (EMCR) of the Year from the enAble Institute, Commendation in Research Supervision from Curtin (2022), Early Career Researcher of the Year for the Faculty of Health Sciences at Curtin (2022), the Charter Hall Research Collaboration Award from the Raine Medical Foundation (2020), Gro Harlem Brundtland Visiting Fellowship from the Norwegian Institute of Public Health (2020), and the Adelaide Scholarship International Award from the University of Adelaide (2015). My research has garnered widespread media coverage, including features in BBC News, The Guardian, Fox News, and Sky tg24.
I am also a founding member and the current president of the Australian-based Ethiopian Researchers Network (ABReN), a registered organization in Australia. Additionally, I serve on the executive committee of the Health Services Research Association of Australia and New Zealand (HSRANNZ), a leading body in health services research.

title: Publications
text:
I published >115 peer-reviewed journal articles, and the remaining are working paper and a policy brief. I was first, second or last author for over 60 articles. As part of the Ethiopian National Burden of Diseases (ENBD) team where I was vice chair, I led and coordinated 10 publications using GBD methods in Ethiopia.
Top 10 Publications Tessema, G. A., S. E. Håberg, G. Pereira, A. K. Regan, J. Dunne, and M. C. Magnus. 2022. “Interpregnancy interval and adverse pregnancy outcomes among pregnancies following miscarriages or induced abortions in Norway (2008-2016): A cohort study.” PLoS Medicine 19 (11)
Tessema, G. A., J. S. Gomersall, C. O. Laurence, and M. A. Mahmood. 2019. “Healthcare providers’ perspectives on use of the national guideline for family planning services in Amhara Region, Ethiopia: A qualitative study.” BMJ Open 9 (2)
Tessema, G., Y. Kinfu, B. A. Dachew, A. Tesema, Y. Assefa, K. Alene, and et al., “The COVID-19 pandemic and healthcare systems in Africa: a scoping review of preparedness, impact and response.” BMJ Global Health 6 (12). Inpress.
Dunne, J., D. Foo, B. A. Dachew, B. Duko, A. T. Gebremedhin, S. D. Nyadanu, G. Pereira, and G. Tessema. 2024. “Diabetic and hypertensive disorders following early pregnancy loss: a systematic review and meta-analysis.” EClinicalMedicine : 102560-102560.
Tessema, G. A., S. E. Håberg, G. Pereira, and M. C. Magnus. 2022. “The role of intervening pregnancy loss in the association between interpregnancy interval and adverse pregnancy outcomes.” BJOG: An International Journal of Obstetrics and Gynaecology 129 (11): 1853-1861.
Tessema, G. A., and G. Pereira. 2020. “Challenging the assumption that interpregnancy interval causes stillbirth in low-income and middle-income countries.” The Lancet Global Health 8 (1): e16-e17.
Erku, D., P. Scuffham, K. Gething, R. Norman, A. B. Mekonnen, G. B. Gebretekle, Y. Assefa, and G. Tessema. 2021. “Stated Preference Research in Reproductive and Maternal Healthcare Services in Sub-Saharan Africa: A Systematic Review.” The Patient: Patient Centered Outcomes Research 15: 287-306.
Tessema, G. A., T. M. Berheto, G. Pereira, A. Misganaw, and Y. Kinfu. 2023. “National and subnational burden of under-5, infant, and neonatal mortality in Ethiopia, 1990–2019: Findings from the Global Burden of Disease Study 2019.” PLOS Global Public Health 3 (6)
Haile, T. G., G. Pereira, R. Norman, and G. A. Tessema. 2024. “Economic burden of adverse perinatal outcomes from births to age 5 years in high-income settings: A protocol for a systematic review.” BMJ Open 14 (1)
